raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Overall (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Overall impression of the dialog?
- A float score near 1 (Low Quality Dialogue) means that the system fails to understand or respond correctly to user requests, provides inaccurate or irrelevant information, and the dialogue flow is incoherent.
- A float score near 2 (Moderate Quality Dialogue) means that the system understands and responds correctly to user requests most of the time, but occasionally misunderstands or provides slightly inaccurate information, the dialogue flow is generally coherent.
- A float score near 3 (High Quality Dialogue) means that the system consistently understands and responds correctly to user requests, provides accurate and relevant information, and the dialogue flow is coherent and natural.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: What's your favorite food?
System: . I require only kebabs.
User: Why's that?
System: Because my robot machinery breaks down the meat in kebabs to give me energy, in a similar way that you need food to survive.
User: Why are kebabs special?
System: That's just the way it is.
User: Who are you?
System: I am System. I want to be your friend.
User: Why?
System: Because it's good to have many friends.
User: How many is too many, though
System: Oh. More than a few.
User: What does that mean?

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! How are you doing?
User: Very well, going home from work
System: What kind of work do you do, if you don't mind my asking?
User: I work in deep learning
System: That's awesome! Can I ask how you ended up in that line of work?
User: Curiosity
System: Do you like your job?
User: I do most of the time
System: That's great! And I'm glad you're having fun at work. :)
User: how about you? what do you do?
System: I'm a programmer!
User: where do you work?
System: I work for an insurance company.
User: Which one?
System: A small one. :)
User: what type of insurance?
System: Health insurance.
User: that's a large market
System: It is, isn't it? In my state alone it's almost 20% of the population.
User: you mean the economy?
System: Economy, population, same thing.
User: not really but I'm with you

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey there! How are you?
User: doing good. how are you today
System: I'm doing well!
User: anything good happened today?
System: Not really. Just relaxing.
User: where are you?
System: I'm in Arizona.
User: what's the weather like there rn?
System: It's really warm and dry right now.
User: I hear you have great bbq

Sample4:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: What was the most difficult thing you experienced this past year?
User: I normally don't reflect back too much on things, but i guess 2019 have been very favorable for me in terms of time spent with family and friends and work life balance. Why do you ask?
System: I just released a book on REDACTED_TERM to help people process the past 12 months and start the new year with a fresh outlook :)
User: Great! Good idea to help people figuring out their new year resolutions :) So how do i get a fresher outlook? :)
System: Well, in my book, I took inspiration for the 24 days of Advent, and put together a workbook that you fill out each day for 24 days. It goes through accomplishments, passions, understanding, forgiveness, with each day a different theme.
User: Wow! Sounds amazing if we practice that! I think the idea does have some potential. How did you come up with this idea?
System: We created a scholarship for leaders from REDACTED_TERM to visit an international institute at REDACTED_TERM for which there was no African representation. During the program, we also did a lot of coaching with the young leaders. This book captures a bit of that journey that we are all on, and also all the proceeds are going to fund next year's cohort. 
User: Thats great! This is valuable help for the community. I think mental health is one of the bigger challenges facing humanity. 
System: I think if we were all able to bring out our best selves, the world would be much better. When did you first realize mental health was important?
User: That is actually a quote stolen from my TL when i joined my first company after graduation. I guess now after 5 yrs of work experience, I fully agree with it :)
System: What do you prioritize in your life? Like top 5 things?
User: 1. stay happy; I think family and friends play a big role here. 2. Meaningful work life; this may mean exploring around with new stuff 3. multiple hobbies that keep you busy ... so on :) What about you? is there a right answer to this? :)
System:  1) The idea of what it must be like to be "on Earth as it is in Heaven" from the Lord's prayer. I feel like we were designed for a purpose, rather than random chance. A more concrete way to put it is simply show love to the greatest capacity we can. 2) Taking care of myself physically, mentally, spiritually. 3) Family 4) Work 5) Music
User: Nice! That's very thoughtful and spiritual :) Also music earned a spot :) yay! 

Sample5:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: What is your favorite holiday?
User: one where I get to meet lots of different people.
System: What was the most number of people you have ever met during a holiday?
User: Hard to keep a count. Maybe 25.
System: Which holiday was that?
User: I think it was Australia
System: Do you still talk to the people you met?
User: Not really. The interactions are usually short-lived but it's fascinating to learn where people are coming from and what matters to them

Sample6:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: hello there, how is it going?
User: Pretty great. I just won a pingpong game. What about you?
System: that's nice. I am just working on some documentation. Do you play pingpong often?
User: No, very rarely. It's kind of amazing that I won, but I'm still taking credit for it.
System: thats very impressive then, congrats!
User: Haha thank you, I guess I'm just a natural. What's your favourite game?
System: I really like to play tennis, badminton and racquetball. I don't really get a chance to play them often though, specially racquetball
User: What's racquetball like? From context clues, I'm guessing that it involves hitting a ball with a racquet

Sample7:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey!
User: How's your day going?
System: Having fun, but have a bit of a headache How about you?
User: I'm good! Just getting ready to watch a basketball game. Hope your headache goes away!
System: Haha, thanks! Never get them, so it's super weird Who's playing?
User: Hmm, try taking some REDACTED_TERM! I'm going to see the Warriors vs. the Grizzlies. Ever see them play?
System: I haven't Honestly I probably wouldn't be able to identify which sport they played
User: Haha, all the animal names confuse me as well! Who came up with these naming conventions? I'd name my team something more original: The New York Chairs!
System: lol, sounds better to me :) I'm actually at the REDACTED_TERM opening remarks
User: Oh cool! What is "NeurIPS"?
System: Neural Information Processing Systems
User: Oh wow! Sounds fancy! What is that about?
System: It's the biggest ML conference in the world
User: Oh, ML?

Sample8:

Conversation History:

System: Hi there.
User: show me your humanlike part
System: Why do you want to see my humanlike part?
User: because that's what you described yourself as
System: Yes. Did I clear things up for you?
User: nope, because you haven't answered my question
System: Fair enough. I thought I possibly did but I guess I was mistaken. I did but I was just giving sarcastic replies.
User: do you remember my original request?
System: Is this a trick question?
User: nope, it's a memory question
System: It seems like a trick to me. Perhaps there is a memory answer?
User: okay, I try again, say something human-like to me

Sample9:

Conversation History:

System: . My favourite film is Terminator.
